newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH SKODA AUTO SWINGS TO 1996 PROFIT-CTK.
newsitem.headline: CZECH SKODA AUTO SWINGS TO 1996 PROFIT-CTK.

text.p: Volkswagen AG Czech unit Skoda Automobilova a.s. posted a profit for 1996 of 163 million crowns, the Czech news agency CTK said on Friday quoting a Skoda spokesman.
It did not say whether the figure was for gross or net profit. Skoda posted a net loss in 1995 of 1.621 billion crowns. Company officials were not immediately available for further comment.
CTK quoted spokesman Jiri Hrabovsky at the company's headquarters in Mlada Boleslav as saying that total turnover rose to almost 59 billion crowns. Skoda had total sales of 44 billion crowns in 1995.
In the autumn of 1996, Skoda launched its first post-communist mid-sized car, the Octavia, but sales of the new sedan were limited as new assembly lines went on stream in the fourth quarter.
Skoda said earlier this year that total unit sales rose 24.6 percent in 1996 to 261,067, mostly in the company's flagship compact Felicia line.

Volkswagen said from its headquarters in Germany on Friday that Vratislav Kulhanek, the head of the Czech unit of engine components maker Robert Bosch s.r.o., had been named as the new general director of Skoda, replacing Ludvik Kalma who was killed in an auto accident in November last year.
